title: INVENTORY / LA FUMEE
description: Vol. 1 No. 2 of *La Fumée*, Martinaise's leading quarterly journal of radical Mazovian thought (PART OF THE COMMUNIST DREAM QUEST)

dialogueTree.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The face of King Frissel smiles at..."
dialogueTree.text: The face of King Frissel smiles at you. For some reason the smile now strikes you as more forced than it did before.

links.title: You: "Read the editor's note."
links.text: Read the editor's note.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: ""Comrade, as you know, this journal..."
links.text: "Comrade, as you know, this journal takes its name from Mazov's immortal expression 'Du cristal à la fumée.' This was his way of describing the way the rigid, crystalline structures of capitalist ideology turn to smoke under communism..."

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: ""But like the structures of capital..."
links.text: "But like the structures of capitalist ideology, we too are at risk of going 'à la fumée.' Unlike many publications which are content to spoonfeed their readers reassuring drivel, *La Fumée* is committed to telling the radical truth, even when that truth may drive away potential subscribers."

links.title: Logic: "Only four issues in and it sounds l..."
links.text: Only four issues in and it sounds like they've already alienated their readership.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Perhaps they've overestimated the m..."
links.text: Perhaps they've overestimated the market demand for this kind of *commentary*.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: ""So please, if you value our radica..."
links.text:
"So please, if you value our radical Mazovian perspective on contemporary politics, culture, and international affairs, please consider subscribing today. 

Yours in struggle, The Editors."

links.title: You: "(Whisper.) "Kim! I think this is a..."
links.text: (Whisper.) "Kim! I think this is a *communist* magazine."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What do you expect? It was laying..."
links.text: "What do you expect? It was laying around the office of the Débardeurs' Union. They're probably *bankrolling* the thing."

links.title: You: "Play it cool. Pretend everything's..."
links.text: Play it cool. Pretend everything's in order.

links.title: You: "I want to catch up on 'Internationa..."
links.text: I want to catch up on 'International Developments'.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "This section includes a long, tedio..."
links.text: This section includes a long, tedious critique of the latest round of free-trade negotiations between the EPIS nations and the Free State of Semenine.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "You also skip over an article about..."
links.text: You also skip over an article about heavy fuel oil smuggling along the Mesque-Messina border, something about bear wrestling in Samara, book riots in Yugo-Graad...

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Whoa-whoa-whoa. *Bear wrestling*? F..."
links.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa. *Bear wrestling*? Flip back to that!

links.title: You: "Alright, let's see what this 'bear..."
links.text: Alright, let's see what this 'bear wrestling' is all about...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "It seems to be part of a new public..."
links.text: It seems to be part of a new public fitness initiative in the People's Republic of Samara (SRV), devised and promoted by none other than President Knezhinisky himself.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "According to this extremely credulo..."
links.text: According to this extremely credulous account, 'Uncle Sport' (as he's affectionately known to his people) has recently decreed bear wrestling the national sport of the SRV.

links.title: You: "Hang on, tell me more about this 'U..."
links.text: Hang on, tell me more about this 'Uncle Sport'.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Based on the description in this ar..."
links.text: Based on the description in this article, he appears to be an extremely competent and democratically elected president.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Sapormat 'Sport' Knezhinisky is wel..."
links.text: Sapormat 'Sport' Knezhinisky is well into his third decade as president of the SRV. Outside Samara he's known for three things: *Brutal* repression of internal dissent, *monumental* corruption, and a near-pathological obsession with physical fitness.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Son, it's only an obsession if its..."
links.text: Son, it's only an obsession if its unhealthy. And there's *nothing* healthier than maintaining a sound body. Also, you're forgetting about the *moustache*.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Right. Like all Samaran men above t..."
links.text: Right. Like all Samaran men above the age of 40, President Knezhinisky wears a truly spectacular walrus moustache.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Don't forget the *moustache*."
links.text: Don't forget the *moustache*.

links.title: You: "Great. Now let's get to the bear wr..."
links.text: Great. Now let's get to the bear wrestling.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "It's quite straightforward. A stand..."
links.text: It's quite straightforward. A standard match features one man (or in some cases, woman) against one bear. Two competitors, one ring, five rounds (or until 'incapacitation')...

links.title: You: "When it says 'bear wrestling', does..."
links.text: When it says 'bear wrestling', does that mean two bears are wrestling *each other*, or...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Of course not. The article makes pl..."
links.text: Of course not. The article makes plain that this is man-on-bear (or in some cases, woman-on-bear) competition. Two competitors, one ring, five rounds (or until 'incapacitation')...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "According to the SRV's Ministry of..."
links.text: According to the SRV's Ministry of Information, the programme has been a tremendous success. Public support stands at 87%, and youth obesity and alcoholism rates are down 12% and 7% respectively.

links.title: Logic: "This is the SRV we're talking about..."
links.text: This is the SRV we're talking about. If you think those are the real numbers there's probably a guy who wants to sell you a bridge in La Cherte.

links.title: You: "I guess it's hard to fight a bear i..."
links.text: I guess it's hard to fight a bear if you're out of shape.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "That's very much the idea. Presiden..."
links.text: That's very much the idea. President Knezhinisky has long maintained that a strong body is the best defence against capitalist aggression.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "Good thing you're a goddamn ox, son..."
links.text: Good thing you're a goddamn ox, son. An ox that fights bears.

links.title: Suggestion: "In shape, out of shape. You've alwa..."
links.text: In shape, out of shape. You've always preferred to rely on your wits.

links.title: You: "I guess it's hard to fight a bear i..."
links.text: I guess it's hard to fight a bear if you're drunk.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Precisely. For too long drink has b..."
links.text: Precisely. For too long drink has been a scourge to the working class, and President Knezhinisky is deeply committed to supplying the people with more wholesome entertainments.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "This is all ass-backwards. Drinking..."
links.text: This is all ass-backwards. Drinking makes it *easier* to fight a bear! Plus, then you'll have a bottle to smash on its head. Easy peasy!

links.title: Physical Instrument: "The Waste Land of Reality is an unf..."
links.text: The Waste Land of Reality is an unforgiving place, but if you ever encounter a bear wandering its roads, you're pretty sure you could take it.

links.title: Volition: "See? There are plenty of ways to fi..."
links.text: See? There are plenty of ways to find meaning in life. You don't *need* booze to feel alive.

links.title: You: "Hmmm. Not sure I trust these number..."
links.text: Hmmm. Not sure I trust these numbers.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "What are you, a statistician? Did t..."
links.text: What are you, a statistician? Did the Moralintern send you on a 'fact-finding' mission? This is the SRV party line, comrade.

links.title: You: ""Kim! Do you think there's any chan..."
links.text: "Kim! Do you think there's any chance our case will take us to the SRV?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The Samaran People's Republic?" Th..."
links.text: "The Samaran People's Republic?" The lieutenant frowns. "No, I should expect not. Why do you ask?"

links.title: You: ""I was thinking it might be fun to..."
links.text: "I was thinking it might be fun to see a bear fight."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They're quite the spectacle, as I..."
links.text: "They're quite the spectacle, as I understand. I've heard they make the people in the front rows wear plastic sheets..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""On account of the blood, you see.""
links.text: "On account of the blood, you see."

links.title: You: ""I was thinking it might be fun to..."
links.text: "I was thinking it might be fun to partake in a bear fight."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose that *would* be somethin..."
links.text: "I suppose that *would* be something to see." The lieutenant seems amused at the thought of you wrestling a bear.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What you do in your spare time is..."
links.text: "What you do in your spare time is your business. In the meantime, I would prefer you focus on our case."

links.title: You: ""No reason.""
links.text: "No reason."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, not too long ago I liste..."
links.text: "You know, not too long ago I listened to a *fascinating radio programme* on traditional Samaran folk dances. The costumes they wear are supposed to be extraordinary..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any event, no, I haven't seen a..."
links.text: "In any event, no, I haven't seen any evidence there's a *Samaran angle* to this case."

links.title: You: "Always good to catch up on foreign..."
links.text: Always good to catch up on foreign affairs. (Return to the table of contents.)

links.title: You: "Seems a little too foreign for my t..."
links.text: Seems a little too foreign for my tastes.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Apparently the material conditions..."
links.text: Apparently the material conditions of other countries hold no interest for you. Your brand of communism is strictly local. So be it...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Face it, you really aren't interest..."
links.text: Face it, you really aren't interested in foreign affairs. You're not even sure where most of these countries are...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "You flip back to the front of the m..."
links.text: You flip back to the front of the magazine. The table of contents unfolds before you.

links.title: You: "What is 'Kunst und Kultur'?"
links.text: What is 'Kunst und Kultur'?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "It takes a moment, but gradually it..."
links.text: It takes a moment, but gradually it dawns on you that 'Kunst und Kultur' must mean 'Arts and Culture'...

links.title: Logic: "*Why* they decided to title this on..."
links.text: *Why* they decided to title this one section in *Walder* is beyond you.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Obviously because it's *cool* to dr..."
links.text: Obviously because it's *cool* to drop random phrases in foreign languages.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "It evokes a sense of recognition an..."
links.text: It evokes a sense of recognition and fellowship among those privileged enough to understand.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "As you leaf through this section, y..."
links.text: As you leaf through this section, you come across several reviews of recent radio-plays, as well as a brief 'Artist Spotlight' featuring a local artist identified only as 'C.S.'

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The main feature, though, is a long..."
links.text: The main feature, though, is a long essay titled 'TipTop Tournée: A Critical Mazovian Perspective'.

links.title: You:"Read the profile of 'C.S.'"
links.text: Read the profile of 'C.S.'

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "This so-called 'Artist Spotlight' i..."
links.text: This so-called 'Artist Spotlight' is really just a brief Q&A, made all the briefer by the subject's evident hostility to her interviewer.

links.title: Authority: "That certainly *sounds* like a cert..."
links.text: That certainly *sounds* like a certain *delinquent youth* who likes to harass you from her balcony.

links.title: You: "Just a moment, what is this 'TipTop..."
links.text: Just a moment, what is this 'TipTop Tournée'?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The actual article is surprisingly..."
links.text: The actual article is surprisingly light on details, but after skimming a page or two you gather that it has *something* to do with motor carriage racing...

links.title: Encyclopedia: "If you don't follow it, you only ev..."
links.text: If you don't follow it, you only ever hear about the ludicrous sponsorships and obscene death toll...

links.title: You: "Alright, let's see what these commu..."
links.text: Alright, let's see what these communists have to say about TipTop.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "You think you're settling in for a..."
links.text: You think you're settling in for a relaxing recap of the most recent season, maybe sprinkled with some nice anecdotes about a few of the more colourful drivers...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Instead you find yourself skimming..."
links.text: Instead you find yourself skimming a 10,000-word feature about all the politically *problematic* aspects of TipTop Tournée.

links.title: You: "Wait, what's wrong with TipTop?"
links.text: Wait, what's wrong with TipTop?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Where to even start? For one, there..."
links.text: Where to even start? For one, there's the crass commercialism of its sponsorships. And then there's the practically *criminal* emphasis on deadly motor crashes...

links.title: Rhetoric: "So, all of it, basically."
links.text: So, all of it, basically.

links.title: You: "Hang on, who wrote this stuff?"
links.text: Hang on, who wrote this stuff?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Oddly enough, this article has *two..."
links.text: Oddly enough, this article has *two* bylines: Nasteb Encalada-Bernal and Exilus Bücher.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Just a moment... those names seem a..."
links.text: Just a moment... those names seem awfully familiar.

links.title: Logic: "You're right, because they're most..."
links.text: You're right, because they're most likely *anagrams* of 'Steban' and 'Ulixes', the student communists.

links.title: Conceptualization: "There's no way those are real names..."
links.text: There's no way those are real names.

links.title: You: "Wait, why aren't they real names?"
links.text: Wait, why aren't they real names?

links.title: Conceptualization: "Have you ever met anyone named 'Exi..."
links.text: Have you ever met anyone named 'Exilus'? Come on, they're plainly pseudonyms.

links.title: Logic: "More than that, they're likely *ana..."
links.text: More than that, they're likely *anagrams*.

links.title: You: "What's so bad about sponsorships?"
links.text: What's so bad about sponsorships?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Under capitalism, the article says,..."
links.text: Under capitalism, the article says, every pursuit has its price. Every pleasure, even one as elemental as the joy of racing others around a track, is reduced to an advertising opportunity.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Thus the so-called *tournée* become..."
links.text: Thus the so-called *tournée* becomes a competition between increasingly meaningless brand signifiers: your discount laundry detergent racing against a pack of Astra cigarettes or even a Frittte...

links.title: You: "Right, but then you get to see them..."
links.text: Right, but then you get to see them *crash*.

links.title: You: "What's wrong with a good motor cras..."
links.text: What's wrong with a good motor crash? They just keep it interesting.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "And that, precisely, is what's prob..."
links.text: And that, precisely, is what's problematic about it. Were it not for the promise of random, *spectacular* violence, audiences would quickly lose interest...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "At the end of the day, it's the des..."
links.text: At the end of the day, it's the destruction of these 750,000-reál racers that you're *really* watching for.

links.title: You: "No, I'm pretty sure I like it for t..."
links.text: No, I'm pretty sure I like it for the racing.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Sure, you *think* that, but *subcon..."
links.text: Sure, you *think* that, but *subconsciously* it's the visions of brand-names being engulfed in flames that you crave.

links.title: Interfacing: "That may be true of your casual, fa..."
links.text: That may be true of your casual, factory-issue TipTopper, but *you're* a genuine torque dork. You practically live for the wail of those superchargers!

links.title: You: "Who do you think you're talking to,..."
links.text: Who do you think you're talking to, article? I've *forgotten* more about fuel-injection systems than you'll ever know.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Believe what you want, but your fas..."
links.text: Believe what you want, but your fascination with machines you'll never so much as *touch* in real life is itself a *textbook* example of commodity fetishism...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "In other words, it's not the engine..."
links.text: In other words, it's not the engines you covet, but the feeling of freedom they're made to signify for you.

links.title: You: "I guess I've never thought about it..."
links.text: I guess I've never thought about it that much.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "That's because you haven't been rea..."
links.text: That's because you haven't been reading *critically*. But don't worry, the whole point of these sorts of articles is to let someone else read critically *for you*.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's the stilted language and overc..."
links.text: It's the stilted language and overconfident tone that's the real giveaway here. You're almost certainly reading a recycled university essay, one that could probably use some edits.

links.title: You: "(Take out your pen.) I'm just going..."
links.text: (Take out your pen.) I'm just going to make a few quick changes...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Armed with your trusty pen, you spe..."
links.text: Armed with your trusty pen, you spend entirely too much time excising meaningless phrases and unsubstantiated claims...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "By the time you're finished the ori..."
links.text: By the time you're finished the original article is nearly illegible.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know, *most* people would just..."
links.text: "You know, *most* people would just write a letter to the editor..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Or even better," he stops to corre..."
links.text: "Or even better," he stops to correct himself, "just leave it be."

links.title: You: "I can't believe someone actually *p..."
links.text: I can't believe someone actually *published* this utter tripe. (Shake your head.)

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The magazine stares back at you def..."
links.text: The magazine stares back at you defiantly. It's pretty sure you just don't *get* it.

links.title: Half Light: "This flimsy magazine is right. Deep..."
links.text: This flimsy magazine is right. Deep down you know the only *true* stakes are life and glory, or death by fiery dismemberment.

links.title: You: "Hell yeah, crashes are what get the..."
links.text: Hell yeah, crashes are what get the blood pumping.

links.title: You: "Wow, you're right. I really *am* ju..."
links.text: Wow, you're right. I really *am* just in it for the violence!

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "You see? One cannot avoid the concl..."
links.text: You see? One cannot avoid the conclusion that TipTop Tournée is simply the apotheosis of "spectacular" entertainment under capitalism.

links.title: You: ""Kim, did you know TipTop Tournée i..."
links.text: "Kim, did you know TipTop Tournée is actually an orgiastic ritual of capitalistic destruction? I had no idea!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can safely say the thought had n..."
links.text: "I can safely say the thought had never crossed my mind, detective." The lieutenant furrows his brow.

links.title: You: ""I wonder what *else* is really jus..."
links.text: "I wonder what *else* is really just a metaphor for life under capitalism."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sure most things are, if the y..."
links.text: "I'm sure most things are, if the young men who wrote this article are to be believed."

links.title: You: ""It's too bad. I thought I liked Ti..."
links.text: "It's too bad. I thought I liked TipTop."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You can still like it, detective...."
links.text: "You can still like it, detective. Just because a couple of fools wrote an article doesn't mean it's true."

links.title: You: ""Kim, you wouldn't believe how badl..."
links.text: "Kim, you wouldn't believe how badly written some of these articles are."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can imagine. Something tells me..."
links.text: "I can imagine. Something tells me there's not exactly a glut of young communists itching to write about TipTop for *La Fumée*..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If I had to wager, I'd say they've..."
links.text: "If I had to wager, I'd say they've never even *seen* the inside of a motor, much less a motor race. I'd take whatever they write with a large grain of salt."

links.title: You: ""Kim, this article says that no one..."
links.text: "Kim, this article says that no one really watches TipTop Tournée for the races."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh, come on. Can this article read..."
links.text: "Oh, come on. Can this article read your mind?"

links.title: You: ""*It* seems to think so.""
links.text: "*It* seems to think so."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant sighs. "A certain ki..."
links.text: The lieutenant sighs. "A certain kind of young man reads one or two books and suddenly thinks he understands the secret structures of reality..."

links.title: You: ""No, I guess not.""
links.text: "No, I guess not."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, there you have it. No reason..."
links.text: "Well, there you have it. No reason to get hung up on the pretentious ramblings of a few young men."

links.title: You: "Sounds dull. (Return to the table o..."
links.text: Sounds dull. (Return to the table of contents.)

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The TipTop Tournée is an interisola..."
links.text: The TipTop Tournée is an interisolary racing series, mostly known for its high speeds, ludicrous sponsorship deals, and high death toll. In Revachol it's held quadrennially on the prestigious Zéro Carrousel racing circuit.

links.title: You: "Let's see what they mean by 'Local..."
links.text: Let's see what they mean by 'Local Concerns'.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Unsurprisingly, much of this sectio..."
links.text: Unsurprisingly, much of this section is taken up with articles declaring unqualified support for the dockworkers' strike.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "You skim the headlines: 'Paint the..."
links.text: You skim the headlines: 'Paint the Harbour Red and White!', 'Martinaise Tames the Wild Pines', 'A City in Revolt', 'First We Take Martinaise, Then We Take La Delta!'.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Finally, there's a brief article by..."
links.text: Finally, there's a brief article by the writer 'G. Martin' accusing the owner of the Capeside Apartments of illegally attempting to evict certain communist tenants simply for not having paid their rent.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Ah, this must be Gaston's handiwork..."
links.text: Ah, this must be Gaston's handiwork.

links.title: You: "Damn communists. Should've killed t..."
links.text: Damn communists. Should've killed the lot of them when they had the chance.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "One of the editorials proclaims tha..."
links.text: One of the editorials proclaims that the more the forces of reaction attempt to crush the body, the more defiant the spirit of communism becomes...

links.title: Endurance: "Sounds like their bodies just haven..."
links.text: Sounds like their bodies just haven't been *crushed* enough yet.

links.title: You: "If it weren't for the Wild Pines al..."
links.text: If it weren't for the Wild Pines all those moochers would be out of a job.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "According to these editorials, priv..."
links.text: According to these editorials, private enterprise is simply a means of organising labour that would already happen regardless...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Absolute nonsense. Whoever wrote th..."
links.text: Absolute nonsense. Whoever wrote this has clearly never built a successful business before.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "It goes on to call the Wild Pines a..."
links.text: It goes on to call the Wild Pines a 'nightmarish transnational leech, sucking the life from the labouring classes of Martinaise'.

links.title: You: "Charging rent just to live somewher..."
links.text: Charging rent just to live somewhere *is* pretty outrageous.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The writer G. Martin remarks dryly..."
links.text: The writer G. Martin remarks dryly that 'capitalists *love* wealth redistribution, so long as it's only redistributed *upward*'...

links.title: Rhetoric: "Good thing your rent-paying days ar..."
links.text: Good thing your rent-paying days are behind you.

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's true. The rentiers have been b..."
links.text: It's true. The rentiers have been bleeding you dry. You really ought to find your own place one of these days.

links.title: You: "Wouldn't it be better for everyone..."
links.text: Wouldn't it be better for everyone if labour and capital could reach some *reasonable* accommodation?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "According to these editorials, ther..."
links.text: According to these editorials, there can be no accommodation with the forces of international capital or their 'mucilaginous allies' in the Coalition...

links.title: Empathy: "Why do communists love puerile insu..."
links.text: Why do communists love puerile insults? And they wonder why they're always being left out in the cold.

links.title: You: "Hold on, what's this about a 'Coali..."
links.text: Hold on, what's this about a 'Coalition'?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Judging from the context, it's some..."
links.text: Judging from the context, it's something very large and fundamental. You should probably know about it already, honestly.

links.title: You: "Why should I care? This doesn't hav..."
links.text: Why should I care? This doesn't have anything to do with me.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The eternal problem, according to G..."
links.text: The eternal problem, according to G. Martin, is that under capitalism the worker is rendered incapable of perceiving their own agency (or lack thereof)...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Thus, they tend to experience their..."
links.text: Thus, they tend to experience their own oppression as though it were happening to somebody else.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Is, is that *true*? Have you felt *..."
links.text: Is, is that *true*? Have you felt *estranged* from your own self recently?

links.title: You: "[Put the magazine away.]"
links.text: [Put the magazine away.]

dialogueTree.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The front of this quarterly journal..."
dialogueTree.text: The front of this quarterly journal features a large, satirical portrait of the late King Frissel. From the sides of his head, a pair of white antlers spread to the corners of the cover.

links.title: You: "Why antlers?"
links.text: Why antlers?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Because white antlers are one of th..."
links.text: Because white antlers are one of the symbols of communism. They represent a society in accord with the natural world and at the same time above it.

links.title: Endurance: "A shameful way to treat a former ki..."
links.text: A shameful way to treat a former king, even one as underwhelming as Frissel.

links.title: You: "Why Frissel?"
links.text: Why Frissel?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "Because Frissel was incompetent, fo..."
links.text: Because Frissel was incompetent, foolish, and cruel. In short, the embodiment of everything the communards wished to overthrow. It's *satire*, you see.

links.title: You: "Flip through the pages, see what ca..."
links.text: Flip through the pages, see what catches your eye.

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "To your disappointment, there aren'..."
links.text: To your disappointment, there aren't any full-colour pictures to direct your attention, just column after column of closely set text, interrupted occasionally by little doodles in black and white...

links.title: Savoir Faire: "No advertisements, you notice. So w..."
links.text: No advertisements, you notice. So who's funding this *radical commentary*?

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "After riffling the pages with your..."
links.text: After riffling the pages with your thumb several times, you return to the table of contents...

links.title: La Fumée, Vol. 1 No. 4: "The magazine is divided into severa..."
links.text: The magazine is divided into several sections: 'International Developments', 'Kunst und Kultur', and 'Local Concerns'. Just inside the cover there's also an editor's note.
